research_findings.finding: Vanilla JavaScript outperforms React/Vue for educational apps targeting children
rationale: Smaller bundle size = faster load on low-end devices
Kids have shorter attention spans, need instant loading
Simpler codebase = easier maintenance for educational orgs
Performance critical for Core Web Vitals (impacts user retention)
research_findings.recommendation: Choose vanilla JS + Vite for educational apps unless complex state management needed

research_findings.finding: Bitcoin concepts can be taught to children ages 8-14 using analogies and progressive difficulty

effective_analogies.bitcoin: Digital money that lives on the internet
effective_analogies.blockchain: Digital record book with pages you can't tear out
effective_analogies.private_keys: Secret passwords to your digital piggy bank
effective_analogies.public_address: Mailbox where others can send you coins
effective_analogies.mining: Solving puzzles to add new pages to the record book

research_findings.recommendation: Use concrete analogies for abstract concepts, validate understanding with quizzes

research_findings.finding: Multi-layered gamification (points + achievements + levels + streaks) maximizes engagement
research_findings.recommendation: Implement multiple reward systems to appeal to different motivation types

research_findings.finding: PIN-protected parent mode balances child independence with parental oversight

trust_factors.transparency: Clear labeling that this is simulation, not real money
trust_factors.safety: No external links, no data collection, offline-capable

research_findings.recommendation: Implement simple but effective parent controls without making app feel restrictive to children

technology_research.finding: PWA with offline-first approach is ideal for educational apps (works anywhere, anytime)
benefits: Works without internet (classroom, travel, limited connectivity)
Can be installed like native app
technology_research.implementation: localStorage + PWA manifest + service worker (optional for caching)

technology_research.finding: Target modern browsers (Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+) sufficient for 95%+ of target audience
technology_research.rationale: Children typically use recent devices with up-to-date browsers, legacy support not critical

ux_research.finding: Large touch targets (44x44px), vibrant colors, clear typography, and immediate feedback are essential

design_specs.attention_span: 8-12 minutes per task, keep interactions short

ux_research.finding: Children increasingly use tablets and phones, must be mobile-first
ux_research.implementation: Responsive design starting at 320px width, touch-optimized interactions

content_strategy.finding: 2-5 minute modules optimal for retaining attention and knowledge retention
content_strategy.structure: Short intro → Relatable analogy → 3-5 key points → Quiz validation
